verses.text: And the \sc Lord\sc* spake unto Moses, saying,
Speak unto the children of Israel, and say unto them, I \add am\add* the \sc Lord\sc* your God.
After the doings of the land of Egypt, wherein ye dwelt, shall ye not do: and after the doings of the land of Canaan, whither I bring you, shall ye not do: neither shall ye walk in their ordinances.
Ye shall do my judgments, and keep mine ordinances, to walk therein: I \add am\add* the \sc Lord\sc* your God.
Ye shall therefore keep my statutes, and my judgments: which if a man do, he shall live in them: I \add am\add* the \sc Lord\sc*.
None of you shall approach to any that is near of kin to him, to uncover \add their\add* nakedness: I \add am\add* the \sc Lord\sc*.
The nakedness of thy father, or the nakedness of thy mother, shalt thou not uncover: she \add is\add* thy mother; thou shalt not uncover her nakedness.
The nakedness of thy father’s wife shalt thou not uncover: it \add is\add* thy father’s nakedness.
The nakedness of thy sister, the daughter of thy father, or daughter of thy mother, \add whether she be\add* born at home, or born abroad, \add even\add* their nakedness thou shalt not uncover.
The nakedness of thy son’s daughter, or of thy daughter’s daughter, \add even\add* their nakedness thou shalt not uncover: for theirs \add is\add* thine own nakedness.
The nakedness of thy father’s wife’s daughter, begotten of thy father, she \add is\add* thy sister, thou shalt not uncover her nakedness.
Thou shalt not uncover the nakedness of thy father’s sister: she \add is\add* thy father’s near kinswoman.
Thou shalt not uncover the nakedness of thy mother’s sister: for she \add is\add* thy mother’s near kinswoman.
Thou shalt not uncover the nakedness of thy father’s brother, thou shalt not approach to his wife: she \add is\add* thine aunt.
Thou shalt not uncover the nakedness of thy daughter in law: she \add is\add* thy son’s wife; thou shalt not uncover her nakedness.
Thou shalt not uncover the nakedness of thy brother’s wife: it \add is\add* thy brother’s nakedness.

Thou shalt not uncover the nakedness of a woman and her daughter, neither shalt thou take her son’s daughter, or her daughter’s daughter, to uncover her nakedness; \add for\add* they \add are\add* her near kinswomen: it \add is\add* wickedness.
Neither shalt thou take a wife to her sister, to vex \add her\add*, to uncover her nakedness, besides the other in her life \add time\add*.
Also thou shalt not approach unto a woman to uncover her nakedness, as long as she is put apart for her uncleanness.
Moreover thou shalt not lie carnally with thy neighbour’s wife, to defile \add thyself\add* with her.
And thou shalt not let \add any\add* of thy seed pass through \add the fire\add* to Molech, neither shalt thou profane the name of thy God: I \add am\add* the \sc Lord\sc*.
Thou shalt not lie with mankind, as with womankind: it \add is\add* abomination.
Neither shalt thou lie with any beast to defile \add thyself\add* therewith: neither shall any woman stand before a beast to lie down thereto: it \add is\add* confusion.
Defile not you yourselves in any of these \add things:\add* for in all these the nations are defiled which I cast out before you:
and the land is defiled: therefore I do visit the iniquity thereof upon it, and the land \add itself\add* vomiteth out her inhabitants.
Ye shall therefore keep my statutes and my judgments, and shall not commit any of these abominations; \add neither\add* any of your own nation, nor any stranger that sojourneth among you:
(for all these abominations have the men of the land done, which \add were\add* before you, and the land is defiled;)
that the land spue not you out also, when ye defile it, as it spued out the nations that \add were\add* before you.
For whosoever shall commit any of these abominations, even the souls that commit \add them\add* shall be cut off from among their people.

Therefore ye shall keep mine ordinance, that \add ye\add* commit not \add any one\add* of \add these\add* abominable customs, which were committed before you, and that ye defile not yourselves therein: I \add am\add* the \sc Lord\sc* your God.
